availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Bibb (Green County, Kentucky, overseer and farmer.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, overseer. Green County, Kentucky, native. Son of Robert Bibb and Sarah Durrett Bibb. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned sixteen enslaved persons in Green County in 1850. Household owned Lucy [Unknown], Nancy [Unknown], Mariah [Unknown], and David [Unknown] in Green County in 1852. Household owned Dick [Unknown] in Green County in 1857. Overseer in Green County in 1860. Household owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Green County in 1860. Farmer in Green County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 99B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 663.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 1, p. 65B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, Greensburg Precinct, p. 403B.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll 994036, Green County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Green County Marriages, Film 00595013.
W.H. Perrin, J.H. Battle, and G.C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, vol. 4 (Louisville, KY: F.A. Battey and Company, 1887), 790.
